div.head: incipit
div.p: The purpose of quoting incipits is to describe the content of the manuscript, i.e. to help identify the texts or their parts, and to indicate the extent and completeness of the texts or their parts. They should not exceed 20 to 30 words and should concentrate on meaningful and substantial phrases from the beginning of the text itself. Most common formulas and eulogies may be omitted and should be marked as gaps and ellipses. If a text begins ex abrutto, this should be mentioned in a note and the first words should be quoted.
